name: TheAtlantic
text: How Kayleigh McEnany, an ardent defender of faith—and Donald Trump—came to think of the press as her enemy. @EmmaOGreen on the White House press secretary: https://t.co/hBmyv7gBE1

name: TheAtlantic
text: "We are public servants. We should reflect the populations we represent. That’s the way you get the best ideas," @marydalyecon tells @AnnieLowrey: https://t.co/vcJeyhWmuN

name: TheAtlantic
text: HBO’s darker, edgier “Perry Mason” remake is strongest when it remembers what was so potent about the original character. @sophieGG on the curse of TV reinvention: https://t.co/9OXdzS8ymW

name: TheAtlantic
text: Once again, this pandemic is at risk of spiraling out of control. The latest Atlantic Daily: https://t.co/2VfU3TKqRn

name: TheAtlantic
text: Astronomers may have captured, for the first time, the flare from a faraway cosmic collision of two black holes, @marinakoren reports. https://t.co/0wOBcHnL1r

name: TheAtlantic
text: "The Chinese Exclusion Cases have never been overruled, which is what allowed the Court to rely on the ideas they expressed. As long as these cases remain good precedent, administrations will be tempted to embrace them," @LeahLitman writes: https://t.co/ub3aCsRDMF

name: TheAtlantic
text: Mountaintop yoga in China, a sunrise over Glastonbury Tor, a sneaky gull in Denmark, a field of lavender in England, “Rays of Victory” in Russia, a concert for plants in Spain, a ski run in Australia, and much more—via @TheAtlPhoto: https://t.co/WxVVPdhA5l

name: TheAtlantic
text: "Thanks to Woodrow Wilson, the Lost Cause ideology came fully into the mainstream, reaching the apex of its influence as America entered the First World War," @MDParadis writes: https://t.co/X6GZUlqEkt

name: TheAtlantic
text: Britain has finally passed a new law allowing for no-fault divorce, all without a culture war, writes @helenlewis: https://t.co/ENZaUJznRo

name: TheAtlantic
text: On Thursday, the Trump administration formally urged the Supreme Court to overturn the Affordable Care Act. Last year, @nicholas_bagley explained how a case that “should’ve been laughed out of contention” could kill Obamacare. https://t.co/OWZBgfkhIf

name: TheAtlantic
text: Once the epicenter of the global pandemic, New York is trying to discourage visitors from new coronavirus hotspots, @russellberman reports: https://t.co/Ns0KFGqKrW

name: TheAtlantic
text: Senator Kamala Harris wants to be Joe Biden's running mate. She just won't say so. @IsaacDovere reports: https://t.co/Sj6mI2ecS5

name: TheAtlantic
text: Four Dutch teens were in the Caribbean for a study-at-sea program when the pandemic shut down travel—so they sailed home, all the way across the Atlantic, to the Netherlands. @julieebeck spoke with them for The Friendship Files: https://t.co/dEswYjYEar

name: TheAtlantic
text: RT @julieebeck: I don’t know if you remember those Dutch teens who had to sail all the way home from Cuba because of the coronavirus, but I talked to them for The Friendship Files, and the trip was just as delightful and full of teen shenanigans as you would hope! https://t.co/2ff1vQ3c6q

name: TheAtlantic
text: "This is the time to move. This is the time to make change." @JulianCastro talks with @AdamSerwer about police reform, the housing crisis, and his own political future: https://t.co/Wjedc8P3t0

name: TheAtlantic
text: In light of the Dixie Chicks announcing yesterday that they'd drop "Dixie" from their name, @bgzimmer explores the word's problematic history as a label for the American South. https://t.co/y48ms1JRv3

name: TheAtlantic
text: Astronomers have picked up an unusual pattern in a cosmic signal coming from 500 million light-years away, @marinakoren reports: https://t.co/VWlfZdLXOg

name: TheAtlantic
text: Examining some of Florida’s many narratives more carefully can lead to a richer understanding of the state, the country, and the nature of storytelling itself, @cray_kate writes. https://t.co/p9aPK4pLDl

name: TheAtlantic
text:
“We hope that our readers can use this compendium for their own education—to digest more fully the difficult but rich history of this country,” @gillianbwhite writes.

The Atlantic’s most important writing about race in America, from 1857 to today: https://t.co/zeeZLIXK79

name: TheAtlantic
text: RT @PeterAtlantic: Senator Kamala Harris wants to be Joe Biden's running mate. She just won't say so, @IsaacDovere writes. https://t.co/x3ws4TA54n

name: TheAtlantic
text: RT @AdrienneLaF: Read @GrahamDavidA's latest. Devastating on a number of levels: https://t.co/1c8NTLfZRc

name: TheAtlantic
text: Netflix’s “365 Days” defies nearly every rule of good filmmaking. Yet it has won viewers over with the promise of vacuous characters and outrageous sex—and become an unlikely summer hit, @ethiopienne writes. https://t.co/x8P5o7fkGZ

name: TheAtlantic
text: "As national events have damaged Trump politically, he has responded to the increased stress by becoming an even more extreme version of himself, which has convinced even more Americans that he’s not the right man for this moment,"@PeterBeinart writes: https://t.co/ZelucdxAXg

name: TheAtlantic
text: "Thanks to Woodrow Wilson, the Lost Cause ideology came fully into the mainstream, reaching the apex of its influence as America entered the First World War," @MDParadis writes: https://t.co/HcFW5c4qYL
